Comment: Booker and Jeffries, the perfect example of the neoliberal corporate-approved "let's not talk about oligarchy" do nothing Democratic party, are outside sitting on the Capitol steps. Nothing could be more symbolic of how useless these guys are.  Remember what a real sit-down strike is. It originated in 1937 Flint Michigan auto plants. Workers sat down at their work stations so that their bosses couldn't bring in replacement workers to take their jobs. Workers took control of the factories and shut it down. That's what a sit-down strike does.  Remember what a real sit-in is? Local black students went to a segregated Woolworths lunch counter and occupied the stools so no one else could take them. They were humiliated, had food poured over them, beaten, dragged away and others took their place. That's what a real sit-in does.   Cory Booker and Hakeem Jeffries are minstrel show wannabees, AIPAC darlings, recipients of lotsa money from Big Pharma, favorable attention from the oligarchic mullahs that ensure we won't have Medicare for All, housing for poor people, jobs for everyone, free university education . . . the basic necessities of life that every other civilized industrialized nation provides for its people.   But the feckless Democratic party, sitting on the steps, will demand our vote in the midterms because "It's us or the fascists!"
Author: Marxian_factotum

Comment: The DEMS will vote for this budget, regardless how horrible it is. Hear me out....  Sure, the GOP wants to pass this budget via reconciliation, but that likely won't work. So they will need DEM votes for a regular order vote.  MAGA Mike played the $ conservatives brilliantly.... he convinced them to go along with vague promises that the Senate will also institute deep cuts (House: 1.5T, Senate 4B) and they relented.  The final budget will no-way-never have anywhere near the 1.5T in cuts, so the House will balk and some GOP senators as well which will prevent it being passed via reconcilliation and it will go to regular order.  This is where the weak DEMS come in... they will be asked to provide the votes so the $ conservatives can vote their conscious while the DEMS will make sure it passes.  You see, not passing this budget, especially raising the debt limit part will literally blow up the entire economy and they are too weak to stomach that. Mike-DEMS 1:0.  Summary: Dems are weak and will vote for this budget.
